name: Front Cable Pull (Narrow Grip)
how_to_perform:
1. Stand facing a cable machine with the cable at chest height, holding a narrow grip handle in each hand.
2. Engage your core and maintain a slight arch in your back, keeping it neutral throughout the exercise.
3. Take a step forward with one foot, keeping the other foot behind you for balance. Make sure to keep your feet shoulder-width apart.

4. Bend your front knee slightly and lean forward at the hips, keeping your arms straight out in front of you.
5. Keeping your elbows slightly bent, pull the handle towards you by contracting your legs, glutes, and lower back muscles.
6. Avoid using momentum or swaying from side to side. Focus on squeezing your core and pulling with your leg muscles.
7. Hold for a brief moment at the top of the movement.
8. Release slowly, keeping control throughout the entire range of motion.
short_summary: Front Cable Pull is a lower body exercise that primarily works the Quads, Hamstrings, Glutes, Calves, and lower back
